medical_history.chief_complaint: Clusters of generalized tonic-clonic seizures (GTCS) occurring every 1-2 months.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Taliah had her first prolonged generalized tonic-clonic seizure (GTCS) at 2 months of age, 12 hours after her first immunization. At 3 months, she experienced another prolonged GTCS following her second immunization. After this, she began having habitual, unprovoked seizures including myoclonic jerks, unclassified unresponsive episodes, and GTCS. Her seizures were drug-resistant, and she experienced several episodes of status epilepticus. At 4 years of age, she had a severe, prolonged GTCS which led to developmental regression. Currently, as an adult, she continues to have clusters of GTCS every 1-2 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Dravet syndrome diagnosed at 10 years of age following genetic testing which identified a pathogenic stopgain variant in SCN1A. Taliah also has a history of thoracolumbar scoliosis corrected surgically at 13 years of age and was diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD).
